parameters: \pop[2]As soon as we arrive home, we head to the kitchen.
\pop[2]Just as expected, there's no beep, or announcement when Isaac unlocks the door.
\pop[2]I assume that he's put his mods back in place after Dante last removed them.
\pop[2]It's weird how far-removed we are from that initial conflict.
\pop[2]Back then, those mods seemed to be a major cause of quarrels in the house.
\pop[2]But things have certainly changed over the last week or so. For everybody.
\pop[2]When I stop to think about it, though, it's still the same central conflict.
\pop[2]It all boils down to how much we're okay with \c[23]Argus\c[0] being in control.
\pop[2]It's still an issue that boils down to society clashing with \c[23]The System\c[0].
\pop[2]At least now, with the people on the streets, things are changing.
\pop[2]For the first time, public opinion is moving in favor of the \c[10]zeros\c[0].
\pop[2]It's like seeing these people, and their plight, changed minds.
\pop[2]I've said it before, but it's a lot easier to fight and discriminate against a concept.
\pop[2]That's what the \c[10]zeros\c[0] were to most of us until a couple weeks ago. A concept.
\pop[2]Something intangible. A convenient target for judgment and hatred.
\pop[2]Thankfully, me and the group were level-headed, and incapable of that hate.
\pop[2]Especially not toward a group of people who just think differently than us.
\pop[2]I wish the people in power were as impartial as we are.
\pop[2]Though I guess calling us impartial is kind of stretching the truth...
\pop[2]Our allegiance is clearly with the \c[10]zeros\c[0], and against our world powers.
\pop[2]I guess it was better to say that we sided with justice, and equality for all.
\pop[4]Well, I think we can strike all worry from the record.
\pop[4]I don't know. I just feel like bringing Kyron home was the ultimate test.
Talking outside, or in a cafe, just doesn't seem as "wrong".
But now we're definitely abetting him. So, there's that.
\pop[4]If they \c[14]were\c[0] watching us, they'd be waiting for a slip-up.
Something they could pounce on, and use to take us down.
But we seem to be fine. There's definitely been no pouncing tonight.
\pop[4]Leave it to Taylor to make \c[14]anything\c[0] thirsty.
But speaking of thirst, you all down for another beer?
\pop[3]That's the one in the can, right?
\pop[4]Usually. I guess it depends on your preference.
We could pour it out on the sidewalk if you'd rather use your fingers.
Something tells me I'll never live that one down.
Hold on, I'll go grab the drinks.
\pop[3]I'm fine without one, if that's okay.
I think I had a few too many at The Wayfarer.
\pop[3]He said he'd hook me up if I ever came back, too.
But I don't think I'll get the chance. Work wouldn't allow it.
\pop[2]Dante returns with the beers, and places them in front of us.
\pop[2]Except for Klace, who already seems intoxicated enough.
\pop[3]I'm probably downplaying it, to be honest.
They basically have to approve my every action.
This hiatus is killing them, I can almost \c[14]feel\c[0] it.
\pop[3]But I promised them more albums, and tours, in exchange.
So that's what sold them. They'd never let me do this for the fun of it.
Everything I do, usually comes down to: "is this making the label money?"
\pop[4]Or costing them money, in this case.
\pop[3]Yeah. I had to cancel a lot of interviews to make this happen.
That's why we had the nightclub to ourselves, as well.
It was gonna be used for an autograph session.
\pop[4]Oh yeah, I remember you saying that.
How much money did that cost the label?
\pop[3]No idea. But I'd guess a lot.
It's not even a good way to meet fans, either.
Most people just want the signed photo so they can sell it.
You have it \c[14]so\c[0] much easier than the rest of us.
\pop[4]How can you tell what their intentions are, though?
I feel like I should ask for the benefit of my \c[14]own\c[0] signings.
\pop[3]Oh, I just have to ask them who I'm signing the photo for.
If they don't want it personalized, they're likely looking to sell it.
At least, that's what they taught me when I was in PR training.
\pop[4]PR training? Like, talking to the media?
Way too intense. I could \c[14]never\c[0] handle that.
\pop[3]There's a few moments that make it all worthwhile.
And for everything else, there's vodka.
\pop[2]Everyone laughs at the joke, and the rest of us raise our beer in the air.
\pop[4]Ready to give it a shot, Kyron?
\pop[3]If I had to answer based on the smell, I'd say no.
But I'm not about to back down from a challenge.
\pop[3]And there's the toast for the night!
Here's to not backing down from a challenge~
\pop[4]Yeah. We stick it out to the very end.
\pop[2]We touch our beer cans together, and each take a swig.
\pop[2]I didn't drink that much tonight, and I'm still perfectly sober.
\pop[2]Had to take it easy, since the Quantum Leap was coming up.
\pop[3]Might as well go outside and bite a pine tree.
\pop[4]It's an acquired taste, I'll give you that much.
\pop[2]He takes another large swig, and coughs soon after.
\pop[2]Isaac leans forward, like he's about to say something important.
I've been getting the backyard ready for the party.
\pop[3]I still think we should've hosted it at my place.
More room, and I got that pool in the back.
\pop[4]You want everyone to know where you live?
I figured I was doing you a \c[14]favor\c[0] by hosting it here.
\pop[4]Besides, I think you'll like what you see.
Sharing a beer while the sun sets is a lot better than staying inside, too.
Go on then, Isaac, show us the way.
